Description: Mosque lamp, made of blue glazed pottery. The lamp has a flattened sub-globular body with a curved shoulder and tall trumpet neck, standing on a low splayed foot-ring with three small pierced lugs for suspension. It is painted in tones of cobalt blue with composite chinoisérie lotuses on scrolling foliate stems above a band of cable ornament and an arcade of stylized palmettes which can be read both as white palmettes on a blue ground or blue palmettes on a white ground. The shoulder with a band of stiff lappets. The neck with a two-tiered inscription in foliated pseudo-Kufic reserved against a brushed cobalt ground between cable bands. The base with a central rosette in a double line medallion.
